block.p: Alexandra Martell Handy and Benjamin John Robins were married last night at Topnotch Resort and Spa in Stowe, Vt. Assistant Judge Barney Bloom of State Superior Court in Montpelier officiated, with the Rev. Lisa M. Ransom, an Episcopal priest, taking part in the interfaith wedding.
Mrs. Robins, 27, is a senior marketing associate at Health Dialog, a health care management company in Boston. She graduated from Duke.

Alexandra Martell Handy and Benjamin John Robins were married last night at Topnotch Resort and Spa in Stowe, Vt. Assistant Judge Barney Bloom of State Superior Court in Montpelier officiated, with the Rev. Lisa M. Ransom, an Episcopal priest, taking part in the interfaith wedding.
Mrs. Robins, 27, is a senior marketing associate at Health Dialog, a health care management company in Boston. She graduated from Duke.
She is a daughter of Merry Handy and Edward W. Handy of Burlington, Vt. Her father is an assistant professor of clinical psychiatry at the University of Vermont College of Medicine.
Mr. Robins, 28, is an associate in the corporate department at Ropes & Gray, the Boston law firm. He graduated magna cum laude from Cornell and received his law degree from New York University.
He is the son of Harry L. Robins of Boca Raton, Fla., and the late Barbara A. Robins. His father works in Boca Raton as a financial adviser for the financial services unit of UBS, the Swiss bank.
